newsitem.title: USA: U.S. EPA to accept new brownfields revival plans.
newsitem.headline: U.S. EPA to accept new brownfields revival plans.

text.p: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency said on Friday that it would begin accepting proposals for pilot programs to clean up and redevelop abandoned industrial sites, so-called brownfields.
The agency expects to choose 25 plans by March 1997, each to receive up to $200,000 over two years to help make the properties productive again.

The proposals are meant to test new ways of reviving the sites by "removing regulatory barriers without sacrificing protectiveness" and coordinating local, state and federal efforts to get rid of contamination on the properties.
